meanings.sent1: The prerecording of the song allowed the singer to focus on their performance during the live show.
meanings.sent2: I listened to the prerecording of the podcast before it was officially released.
meanings.sent3: The prerecording of the baby's first words was played at their graduation party, much to everyone's delight.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a prerecording, playing back the events of that day with perfect clarity.
meanings.sent5: The prerecording of the thunderstorm made it sound even more intense and dramatic.

meanings.sent1: We need to prerecord the announcement for tomorrow's meeting.
meanings.sent2: The radio show prerecorded the interview with the author to ensure smooth playback.
meanings.sent3: She decided to prerecord her laughter so she could play it back whenever she needed a pick-me-up.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to prerecord every detail of the crime scene, making him an excellent detective.
meanings.sent5: The birds seemed to prerecord their songs, filling the forest with beautiful melodies.
